section.name: StaticDropdown configuration
section.p: In the document namespace, nodetype section, the hipposysedit:type property of your field should be set to StaticDropdown. For example at "/hippo:namespaces/gettingstarted/textdocument/hipposysedit:nodetype/hipposysedit:nodetype/names",

In the document namespace, editor section, the cluster.options child node of your field should contain a String property selectable.options with a comma delimited string, defining your static options in the dropdown.

In the same example, you can have the StaticDropdown type node at "/hippo:namespaces/gettingstarted/textdocument/editor:templates/_default_/names" and it has a cluster.options child node. Add a String property named selectable.options in the cluster.options child node with the values you need, e.g. "Apple,Pear,Orange".
Since release 2.08.02, StaticDropDown supports key/label pairs as well. For example, you can configure it like the following:
section.source: <sv:node sv:name="cluster.options"> <sv:property sv:name="jcr:primaryType" sv:type="Name"> <sv:value>frontend:pluginconfig</sv:value> </sv:property> <sv:property sv:name="selectable.options" sv:type="String"> <sv:value>=Not specified,linux=Linux,win=Windows,osx=Mac OS X</sv:value> </sv:property> </sv:node>
section.p: Note: Each option item can be a key/label pair, delimitered by the first '='. (If there's no key/label pair delimiter found, then key value is used for label as well.) In the example above, it will generate options like the following:
section.source: <select ...> <option value="">Not specified</option> <option value="linux">Linux</option> <option value="win">Windows</option> <option value="osx">Mac OS X</option> </select>
